aka: One Hundred Years : The Journey of the Family
trans_title: One Hundred Years : The Journey of the Family
introduction: The minister LEE In-ha, a first-generation Korean Japanese who has been a central figure in the human rights movement since the 1970s in Kawasaki RO Eun, a first-generation Japanese from Joseon who graduated from Daegu School of Education and has devoted to the education of ethnicity to the Korean residents in Japan the American graduate student, Ellis FOXWORTH, who studies the Korean Japanese and Joseon’s literature living in the house of KWAK Jong-su, a second-generation Korean Japanese the third-generation Korean Japanese LEE Yong-gyu, who is concerned about his identity and a career choice while working as the member of the council of foreign citizen representatives. The film presents the meeting of people from various countries, of diverse races, and of different generations and their life.
